alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Valley; Dawson; Garfield; McCone; Richland; Western Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:28PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Garfield, southwestern Roosevelt, southeastern Valley, McCone, northwestern Dawson and west central Richland Counties through 930 PM MDT... At 827 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Frazer, or 20 miles southwest of Wolf Point, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Wolf Point, Circle, Richey, Frazer, Vida, Nelson Creek Rec Area, Rock Creek Rec Area, Oswego, Haxby and Weldon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Fort Peck Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until this storm passes.
